All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
BlackScreen
The end screen of the game when the user leaves the game.
BoldText
The BoldText class displays bolded text on the screen with a specific font size and color.
BorderBox
The BorderBox class is used to create a simple rectangular border box in the Greenfoot environment.
Calculator
The Calculator class represents an interactive calculator icon in the Greenfoot environment.When the user clicks on this icon, it opens the MathTutorial screen, which likely contains a tutorial or educational content related to mathematics.
CheckConfirm
The CheckConfirm class represents a checkmark confirmation button in the Greenfoot environment.
Cross
The Cross class represents a cross (X) button in the user interface.
Food
Food class represents a food item that can be used to increase a pet's fullness.
GameOverButton
The GameOverButton class represents a button that appears when the game is over.
GameState
GameState class manages the saving and loading of game data.
Gift
Gift class represents a gift item that can be used to increase a pet's happiness.
Hand
The Hand class represents a hand animation that appears when the player pets their virtual pet.
HoursBox
The HoursBox class allows the user to select and adjust the hour value.
IncorrectScreen
Write a description of class IncorrectScreen here.
InteractionButton
The InteractionButton class represents a clickable button on the PlayWithPetScreen that triggers a specific interaction with the pet, such as playing or feeding.
Inventory
Inventory class manages the collection of food and gift items for a pet.
InventoryIcon
The InventoryIcon class represents an icon used to access the player's inventory.
InventoryScreen
The InventoryScreen class displays the player's inventory items dynamically based on the provided inventory array from the backend.
ItemImage
The ItemImage class represents an item image that temporarily appears on the screen.
LetsGoButton
The LetsGoButton class represents a clickable button that allows the user to start the Math game.
LoadPetScreen
LoadPetScreen displays all alive pets passed from the backend.
MainMenu
 
MathBackend
MathBackend handles the generation of math questions for the math game.
MathGame
MathGame is the main game world where the player can answer math questions to win prizes.
MathTutorial
A simple world that serves as a tutorial for the math game.
MinutesBox
The MinutesBox class represents a clickable UI element that displays and allows adjustment of minute values in a 24-hour clock format.
NextQButton
The NextQButton class represents a button that allows the player to proceed to the next question in the Math tutorial.
ParagraphText
The ParagraphText class is responsible for displaying a block of text (paragraph) in the Greenfoot environment.
ParentalControls
Screen where parental settings can be set.
ParentalToggle
Write a description of class Parentaltoggle here.
PasswordScreen
This world lets parents enter their password that will allow them to access the parental controls screen.
Pet
Pet represents the virtual pet and handles its mood/state images.
PetClass
PetClass represents the core pet management system for a virtual pet game.

Player
Player class manages player-related data and operations in the virtual pet game.
PlayWithPetScreen
PlayWithPetScreen is the main interactive area with the pet.

ReviveButton
ReviveButton navigates the player to the RevivePetScreen when clicked, showing all dead pets passed from the backend.
RevivePetScreen
RevivePetScreen displays all dead pets passed from the backend.

A toggle button that puts the pet to sleep or wakes it up.
SoundManager
SoundManager handles all sound-related functionality in the game.
StatBar
